title: Director, Communications and Public Affairs
description:
**Title:**  
Director, Communications and Public Affairs  
  
**Department:**  
NJTPA  
  
**Reports To:**  
Senior Director, Communications & External Affairs  
  
**Position Type:**  
Staff  
  
**Position Summary:**  
Under the direction of the Senior Director of Communications & External Affairs, the Director of Communications & Public Affairs oversees all NJTPA Board and committee meetings, working closely with trustees, county and municipal staff, and partner agencies. This position oversees the preparation and dissemination of all support materials for Board and Committee meetings (speeches, agendas, presentations, etc.) and other communications products, including videos, reports, brochures, and publications. The Director also maintains the NJTPA’s website and tracks federal legislation, policy, and grant opportunities of relevance to Board members. The ideal candidate will have management and editing experience, be highly organized, detail oriented and able to juggle multiple tasks. This is a hybrid position based in Newark, NJ with the option to work remotely part of the time.  
  
**Essential Functions:**  

* Manages the Communications & Public Affairs staff. This group supports the NJTPA Board of Trustees and its committees and disseminates information to raise awareness of the agency.
* Oversees board-related activities, including preparing speeches, presentations, reviewing and distributing meeting materials and responding to Board member requests for information.
* Works with the graphic designer to prepare fact sheets, posters, reports and other materials about NJTPA-funded programs and projects.
* Oversees video production, including assisting with script development and story boarding.
* Monitors significant developments related to the NJTPA subregions and Board members, including media coverage.
* Oversees the NJTPA’s website, including managing a consultant, and works with staff to regularly update pages. This includes writing and editing blog posts and webpage content.
* Monitors federal legislation and funding opportunities of interest to the NJTPA and its subregions, and drafts letters of support for grant applications.
* Compiles Annual Report and provides editorial support to staff throughout the agency including reviewing publications, reports, letters and documents prior to public release.
* Works with staff in other divisions on the development of the Long Range Transportation Plan and policy papers.
* Serves as a member of the NJTPA’s Leadership Team, meeting regularly with other supervisors to coordinate and collaborate on agency initiatives, including development of the annual work program and the budget for Communications & Public Affairs Division activities, which includes funding for publications and freelance photographers.

  
**Additional Functions:**  

* Works with staff in other divisions to identify and highlight relevant data and findings of technically oriented studies and planning efforts, including participating in interdivisional working groups.
* Participates in discussions, strategy sessions and other meetings as necessary, particularly to ensure agency communications/messaging strategy is being implemented agency-wide and complies with the Public Engagement Plan.
* Assists with arranging speakers for Board meetings and other events, such as symposia.
* Assists with media relations, including preparing press releases.

  
**Prerequisite Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited college in communications, journalism, public policy, planning or related field required.
* Minimum of eight years of experience in public affairs, journalism, communications, planning or related field, with supervisory experience.
* Strong writing and research skills (professional writing samples required and writing/editing test may be administered)
* Detail-oriented with keen eye and experience copy editing, proofreading and fact-checking.
* Self-motivated with ability to work well independently and collaboratively with cross-functional teams.
* At the university’s discretion, the education and experience prerequisites may be excepted where the candidate can demonstrate to the satisfaction of the university, an equivalent combination of education and experience specifically preparing the candidate for success in the position.

  
**Preferred Qualifications:**  

* Master’s degree in communications, journalism, public policy, planning or related field preferred.
* Minimum 10 years of experience, with three years supervisory experience.
* Experience working at a metropolitan planning organization or other regional planning agency or public agency.
* Experience with website publishing and content management systems.
* Knowledge of government, development, planning, transportation and urban affairs.

  
**Bargaining Unit:**  
Non-Aligned  
  
**Range/Band:**  
8  
  
**FLSA:**  
Exempt  
Full-Time  
  
**Special Instructions to Applicants:**  
Please submit a cover letter along with your resume. This is a grant funded position that is not eligible to applicants who require sponsorship.

  

* As an EEO employer NJIT is committed to building a diverse and inclusive teaching, research, and working environment and strongly encourages applications from individuals with disabilities, minorities, veterans, and women.
* As a Minority Serving Institution with designations as an Asian American and Native American Pacific Islander Serving Institution (AANAPSI) and Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI), NJIT is committed to embracing diversity, centering equity, and practicing inclusion with the goal of sustaining a culture of belonging. NJIT celebrates the diversity of our university community and recognizes the cultural and personal contributions each member of the community brings to NJIT. We strive to cultivate a campus culture that promotes inclusive excellence among our faculty, staff, students, and external partners. Sustaining and building upon our diverse community is critical to NJIT’s continuing status as a premier research institution of higher education and a leading polytechnic university.
* Employment at NJIT is subject to the provisions of New Jersey First Act which mandates new employees, who are not NJ residents, to establish primary residence in New Jersey within one year of their appointment to certain positions. The law does not apply to any individual employed at NJIT on a temporary or per semester basis as a visiting or adjunct professor, teacher, lecturer, researcher or administrator. For more information on the act please click here.
* If special accommodations are needed in applying for a position, please visit the Department of Human Resources located in Fenster Hall, Room 500, University Heights, Newark, NJ 07102 or call (973) 596-3140. If you have questions, please email the Human Resources Department at hr@njit.edu.
* Information regarding NJIT campus security, personal safety, and fire safety including topics such as, disciplinary procedures, crime prevention, NJIT Police law enforcement authority, crime reporting policies, and crime statistics for the most recent three year period is available on the NJIT Department of Public Safety here.
* NJIT is an E-Verify employer and uses E-Verify to confirm work authorization of each new hire.

title: Interior Designer
description:
**Interior Designer**

***Location: New York***

  

**Who We Are:**

We design places where people love to be together.

Populous is a global design firm that began with a singular focus: to draw people together around the things they love, through experiences that capture all the senses, amplifying the atmosphere of excitement and pure joy shared in human moments.

We’ve designed and delivered some of the world's most memorable civic, sports and entertainment buildings, from iconic stadia to ground-breaking live music venues. Populous is where architects and designers of all kinds create moments bigger than ourselves. We offer the best of both worlds: the resources and impact of the design giants and the tightly knit atmosphere and growth opportunities of smaller firms.

  

**What We Offer:**

Professional & Personal Development Programs + Summer Hours + Hybrid Schedule + + Paid Architect Licensure & Certifications Exams + Wedding Pay + Charitable Match Program + Market Leading Wellness Health and Welfare Benefits.

  

**Who We Are Looking For:**

Our preferred candidate will have prior experience in the AEC industry, and an interest in working in a dynamic global design environment with a diverse range of public assembly building types, including sports venues, convention centers, and transportation facilities.

  

**What Your Day Could Consist Of:**

* Ability to work in a dynamic, creative environment, providing design and documentation across all aspects of the interiors process in various media formats.
* Strong hospitality design experience required.
* Creative design thinking with expertise in spatial and environmental design, branding development, story creation, and graphic design.
* Strong conceptual design, organizational, presentation, and technical skills.
* Ownership of multiple concurrent projects with resilience to switch gears quickly in a fast-paced environment.
* Confidence and comfort interacting with clients, participating in, and leading presentations, meetings, and collaborative sessions.
* Ability to quickly earn trust, build partnerships, and direct large consultant teams.
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects with minimal supervision.
* Ability to both give and take directions effectively.
* Deep passion for design.
* Superior visual, written, and spoken communication skills to express concepts in captivating ways.
* Detail-oriented and comfortable working in demanding environments.
* Strong sketching and freehand drawing skills, with the ability to create quick sketches to convey or sell ideas effectively.

**Essential Qualifications:**

* Master's or Bachelor's degree in Interior Design, Interior Architecture, or Architecture.
* NCIDQ certification with 7+ years of relevant experience.
* Proficiency in Revit, Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.
* Experience in rendering, both computer-generated and freehand**.**

**Additional details:**

* Travel will be required.
* Overtime may be necessary.

**Compensation:**

* The projected salary range for this opportunity is $103,422 - $119,277 annually, and may be more or less depending on skills, experience and education.

Populous offers a competitive salary and bonus packages. We strive to offer our staff the best benefits package in the industry, at the lowest cost to employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k, FSA/HSA, paid time off and continuing education benefits. Populous is an equal opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws.

*No. 1 Most Innovative Company in Architecture by Fast Company*

*No. 1 Firm in Cultural on Interior Design magazine’s Top 100 Giants*

*No. 1 Architecture Firm in Cultural Facilities by BD+C*

*No. 1 Architecture Firm in Convention Centers by BD+C*

*No. 1 Architecture Firm in Performing Arts and Concert Venues by BD+C*

**Find us here -** **https://populous.com/careers**

title: Architect
description:
**Architect**

*Location: New York*

  

**Who We Are:**

We design places where people love to be together.

Populous is a global design firm that began with a singular focus: to draw people together around the things they love, through experiences that capture all the senses, amplifying the atmosphere of excitement and pure joy shared in human moments.

We’ve designed and delivered some of the world's most memorable civic, sports and entertainment buildings, from iconic stadia to ground-breaking live music venues. Populous is where architects and designers of all kinds create moments bigger than ourselves. We offer the best of both worlds: the resources and impact of the design giants and the tightly knit atmosphere and growth opportunities of smaller firms.

  

**What We Offer:**

Professional & Personal Development Programs + Summer Hours + Hybrid Schedule + Paid Architect Licensure & Certifications Exams + Wedding Pay + Charitable Match Program + Market Leading Wellness Health and Welfare Benefits.

  

**Who We Are Looking For:**

Our preferred candidate will have prior experience in the AEC industry, and an interest in working in a dynamic global design environment with a diverse range of public assembly building types, including sports venues, convention centers, and transportation facilities.

  

**Populous’ New York Office**

The New York office opened in early 2016. The office is now located in the famed Starrett-Lehigh Building, on 26th Street in between 11th Avenue and the West Side Highway. The office focuses on a wide range of project types and services including sports and entertainment venues, theatre and performing arts, aviation, convention centers, hospitality, mixed-use projects, and interior design. It is an office founded on critical thinking and an ability to leverage digital technologies in the service of exceptional design. Populous’ New York office is a dynamic and growing group with a wide range of skills and experience.

Preferred candidates to join our New York team will have an interest in working in a dynamic and collaborative global design environment with an emphasis on communication and pushing the boundaries of what’s possible.

  

**What Your Day Could Consist Of:**

**Design Conceptualization and Development**

* Focus on creating and developing solutions to meet project programmatic requirements.
* Provide leadership in technical development and contribute to detailed project documentation.

**Creative Media Expertise**

* Utilize a diverse skill set across multiple media platforms, including illustration, computer-generated renderings, animations, and motion graphics for visual communication.

**Project Design and Documentation**

* Lead efforts to develop, modify, and review design concepts, production drawings, and construction documents in alignment with established standards and technical expertise.
* Create and refine design concepts during schematic and design development stages.

**Research and Analysis**

* Conduct or assist with operational and design research, building and systems programming, site and building analysis, and report preparation.

**Stakeholder Engagement**

* Prepare and deliver design presentations to clients, communities, and relevant stakeholders, including public agencies.
* Collaborate directly with clients on project management throughout the design development and construction administration phases.

**Construction Administration**

* Support Project Managers in the construction administration process, ensuring design intent is maintained and project goals are achieved.
* Perform all other duties as required to support the successful execution of projects.

  

**Requirements For Success:**

* Exceptional communication skills with a team-oriented mindset.
* Self-motivated and capable of thriving in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.
* Proficiency in inventive and creative design thinking, collaborative problem-solving, architectural production, spatial and environmental design, story development, and delivering high-quality design solutions.
* Experience with rendering and 3D modeling software, including 3DS Max, SketchUp, and Maxwell Render, is preferred.
* Familiarity with Revit is highly desirable.
* Strong sketching and freehand drawing skills, with the ability to create quick, impactful sketches to effectively communicate and sell ideas.
* Preferred expertise in Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.

**Essential Qualifications:**

* Professional Degree in Architecture (B. Arch or M. Arch) from an accredited program.
* Registered Architect with a current license.
* 6+ years of professional architectural experience.

**Additional details:**

* Travel will be required.
* Overtime may be necessary.

**Compensation:**

* The projected salary range for this opportunity is $95,939 - $107,525 annually, and may be more or less depending on skills, experience and education.

Populous offers a competitive salary and bonus packages. We strive to offer our staff the best benefits package in the industry, at the lowest cost to employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k, FSA/HSA, paid time off and continuing education benefits. Populous is an equal opportunity employer. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, genetic information, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws.

*No. 1 Most Innovative Company in Architecture by Fast Company*

*No. 1 Firm in Cultural on Interior Design magazine’s Top 100 Giants*

*No. 1 Architecture Firm in Cultural Facilities by BD+C*

*No. 1 Architecture Firm in Convention Centers by BD+C*

*No. 1 Architecture Firm in Performing Arts and Concert Venues by BD+C*

**Find us here -** **https://populous.com/careers**

title: Sr. Interior Designer
description:
**Senior Interior Designer**

***Location: New York***

  

**Who We Are:**

We design places where people love to be together.

Populous is a global design firm that began with a singular focus: to draw people together around the things they love, through experiences that capture all the senses, amplifying the atmosphere of excitement and pure joy shared in human moments.

We’ve designed and delivered some of the world's most memorable civic, sports and entertainment buildings, from iconic stadia to ground-breaking live music venues. Populous is where architects and designers of all kinds create moments bigger than ourselves. We offer the best of both worlds: the resources and impact of the design giants and the tightly knit atmosphere and growth opportunities of smaller firms.

Applicants must possess exceptional design and technical abilities. The best candidate will be self-motivated and directed, and eager to learn within a fun, collaborative atmosphere.

* Proficiency in Revit, Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.

**Compensation:**

The projected salary range for this opportunity is $129,733 - $152,166 annually, and may be more or less depending on skills, experience and education.

  

Populous offers a competitive salary and bonus packages. We strive to offer our staff the best benefits package in the industry, at the lowest cost to employees, including medical, dental and vision coverage, 401k, FSA/HSA, paid time off and continuing education benefits. title: Graphic Designer
description:
Digital Remedy, a performance marketing partner, is seeking a talented and versatile Graphic Designer to join our growing marketing team. This individual will play a key role in supporting the creation of compelling visual assets that elevate our brand and drive performance across channels. From marketing collateral and sales support materials to ad creative and website design, the Graphic Designer will collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to deliver polished, impactful design work that adds real value to our go-to-market efforts. This position can be remote.

This role is ideal for someone with 3â€“5 years of corporate design experience who's ready to take ownership of design initiatives, contribute creatively, and work closely with our Senior Designer to evolve and maintain a consistent, high-quality visual identity. Experience in ad tech or B2B SaaS is a plus.

Responsibilities:

* Design and produce high-quality visual assets across a range of formats including PDFs, presentations, social graphics, digital ads, email templates, and more.
* Collaborate with the Senior Designer and VP of Marketing to bring the Digital Remedy brand to life across every touchpoint.
* Support the design and maintenance of the Digital Remedy website, ensuring a strong UX and cohesive branding throughout.
* Translate content and campaign goals into eye-catching visuals that resonate with target audiences.
* Contribute to thought leadership efforts by designing visuals for webinars, podcasts, whitepapers, and reports.
* Create branded templates, swag, event materials, and other collateral as needed.
* Manage multiple design projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery and stakeholder alignment.
* Uphold brand standards while pushing for creative excellence and innovation.

Our Ideal Candidate:

* Degree or certification in Graphic Design or a related field.
* 3â€“5 years of in-house or agency experience in a fast-paced, business-focused environment.
* Strong portfolio showcasing commercial work across digital, print, and web design.
* Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and other relevant design tools.
* Familiarity with basic HTML/CSS and CMS platforms a plus.
* Experience with email marketing software
* Experience with video creation and editing
* Comfortable designing assets for B2B marketing campaigns and sales enablement.
* A strong eye for visual hierarchy, typography, layout, and consistency.
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to work collaboratively with stakeholders.
* Organized, detail-oriented, and self-motivated with a proactive approach to feedback and revisions.
Experience in ad tech or performance marketing preferred but not required.  

  

Sinclair is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and a drug free workplace. Employment practices will not be influenced or affected by virtue of an applicant's or employee's race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military or veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

  

**About Us**

  

Sinclair, Inc. (Nasdaq: SBGI) is a diversified media company and a leading provider of local news and sports. The Company owns, operates and/or provides services to 185 television stations in 86 markets affiliated with all the major broadcast networks; and owns Tennis Channel and multicast networks Comet, CHARGE!, TBD., and The Nest. Sinclair's content is delivered via multiple platforms, including over-the-air, multi-channel video program distributors, and the nation's largest streaming aggregator of local news content, NewsON. The Company regularly uses its website as a key source of Company information which can be accessed at www.sbgi.net.

  

**About the Team**

  

The life-blood of our organization is our people. We have a compelling story, a goal-oriented culture, and we take really good care of people. How good? Here is a glimpse: great benefits, open door policy, upward mobility and a strong desire to see you succeed. Ready to be part of a winning team? Let's talk.

The base salary compensation range for this role is $55,000 to $65,000. Final compensation for this role will be determined by various factors such as a candidates' relevant work experience, skills, certifications, and geographic location. Full time positions are eligible for benefits that include participation in a retirement plan, life and disability insurance, health, dental and vision plans, flexible spending accounts, sick leave, vacation time, personal time, parental leave and employee stock purchase plan

title: Landscape Designer/Sales
description:
Do you enjoy helping clients envision a new outdoor living space with award winning landscape designs? If you are a professional, who is an assertive and experienced **Landscape Designer/Sales** who likes the challenge of developing new business, Borst LandscapeDesign is the place for you!

We are a nationally recognized, award-winning, full-service landscape design company. From site design plans by one of our design professionals, to yearly organic lawn care and maintenance programs, to custom masonry, we offer landscaping services throughout Bergen County and the Northern New Jersey area.

Our primary goal is to create satisfied customers by creating and maintaining practical and aesthetically pleasing landscapes while providing the highest quality products and services. We believe in conducting our business socially, ethically, and responsibly.

Becoming a member of our team will enable you to experience our culture and values on a daily basis. We are client-focused by demonstrating our integrity, creativity, innovation, and professionalism. We value our team members' knowledge and expertise while making teamwork and safety a priority. If you are an individual who likes a challenge and is growth-oriented, Borst Landscape and Design is interested in meeting you!

As a **Landscape Designer**/**Sales**, you are responsible for meeting with clients, understanding their requirements, and creating detailed designs and plans, and manage client accounts to ensure client satisfaction and alignment with their vision. You should have excellent knowledge of various plants and their growth requirements, understand aesthetic design principles, and be able to work within budget constraints.

In this role, your primary responsibilities involve developing and presenting both conceptual and schematic designs for construction site plans, while also creating visually compelling graphics using hand drawings and advanced design software tailored for residential landscapes. Attention to detail is essential to prepare comprehensive documents, plans, and renderings that clearly communicate the design vision to clients. Executing these site plans necessitates a deep understanding of grading, drainage, and intricate planting designs, all while assessing and analyzing the site conditions, including soil quality, slope, drainage, and existing vegetation. You must be comfortable with collaborating with the construction team to ensure the design plans are accurately realized in the field. This role requires effective negotiation of contracts with clients and vendors, along with the preparation of necessary documents for local approvals and permits.

You must possess excellent communication skills to articulate design concepts clearly and effectively to clients. You must prior sales experience in the landscape industry, with a strong understanding of plants and horticulture to tailor designs to meet specific client specifications.

If you are a results-driven individual with a passion for **Landscape Design/Sales,** we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

title: Graphic Designer
description:
Clearwater’s Marketing & Communications team is looking for a creative and detail-oriented Graphic Designer with a strong foundation in layout, typography, color, and production. This role is ideal for someone with 3–7 years of experience who is passionate about bringing brand stories to life across digital and print touchpoints—and thrives in a collaborative, fast-paced environment.

The Graphic Designer will support a wide range of marketing initiatives—from idea through execution—creating high-quality deliverables that align with our brand standards and engage our key audiences. You’ll work closely with cross-functional Marketing team members (events, content, demand generation) as well as external partners to execute cohesive and impactful designs.

Responsibilities:

* Design a variety of digital and print assets, including brochures, one-pagers, event booth and collateral, web pages, social media graphics, digital ad campaigns, and PowerPoint presentations.

* Translate brand identity consistently across all touchpoints while finding creative ways to evolve and strengthen visual storytelling.

* Refine PowerPoint presentations in line with brand standards and design aesthetics.

* Collaborate with Marketing team members to bring ideas to life and contribute to campaigns with a digital-first mindset.

* Maintain a high level of craft, attention to detail, and execution quality across all design work.

* Stay current on design trends, tools, and techniques, and proactively contribute fresh ideas to the team.

Required Qualifications:

* Digital portfolio required

* 3–7 years of professional design experience in-house, at an agency, or in a fast-paced environment.

* A strong digital portfolio demonstrating excellent layout, typography, color, and visual storytelling across both digital and print media.

* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Figma, and PowerPoint.

* Solid understanding of color, grid systems, hierarchy, and file production.

* Ability to manage multiple projects, meet deadlines, and adapt to evolving needs.

* Experience working with brand guidelines and creating assets from scratch or using templates.

* Familiarity with motion graphics and video formats is a plus, but not required.

What we offer:

* Business casual atmosphere in a flexible working environment

* Team focused culture that promotes innovation and ownership

* Access cutting edge investment reporting technology and expertise

* Defined and undefined career pathways allowing you to grow your own way

* Competitive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits

* Maternity and paternity leave

* Personal Time Off and Volunteer Time Off to give back to the community

* RSUs as well as employee stock purchase plan and 401k with match

* Work from anywhere 3 weeks out of the year

* Work from home Fridays

Salary Range

$80,000 - $115,000

*This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be* *determined* *based on relevant experience, other job-related* *qualifications/skills,* *and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to* *modify* *this pay range at any time. For this role, benefits* *include:* *health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), PTO, parental leave, and medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits. Clearwater Analytics is An Equal* *Opportunity/Affirmative* *Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status,* *age* *or any other federally protected class*

title: Apparel Design Assistant
description:
**Who We Are:**

Capelli Sport is a global multi-sports brand based in New York City and New Jersey, specializing in team sports. With a strong club community reaching all corners of the world, we empower and unite people from amateur, to youth and pro clubs. Our goal is to build equal and diverse playing fields where everyone can be themselves, live up to their full potential, and enjoy safe experiences. Our passion for creating products from lifestyle apparel to footwear and performance match kits enables athletes and teams to maximize their success on the field and beyond. Capelli Sport supports all athletes through a unique global sports ecosystem with a focus on service excellence. With years of knowhow on our side, we always deliver an exceptional customer experience. By players, for players, Capelli Sport is deeply rooted in sports culture.

**What We Are Looking For:**

We are currently seeking a Apparel Design Assistant for Capelli Sport. The overall aim of this role is to assist the Design team in developing new products and designs to meet our product line and customer needs. The ideal candidate will be serious about having a career, not just a job. This role is within Various Sports Goods categories, experience, knowledge and interest in that sports and fitness industry is a requirement.

\\*\\*Read Carefully\\*\\*

If you are interested in this position, please email your resume to **talent.hiring@capellisport.com**

**Responsibilities:**

* Work alongside Design in its day-to-day creative projects while maintaining its organization
* Assist in new projects, cad and tech pack revisions, create presentation line sheets
* Work closely with the Design Director in the seasonal creation process of women’s, men’s and youth design, taking ownership along the way and bringing new ideas and inspiration to the brands
* Research and identify current trends compiling results in various presentation formats and tools for creative direction
* Apply trend results into fresh designs and design capsules meeting our customer profiles within our mass market footprint
* Create new development tech packs and BOMs within PLM, with great attention to detail following them through into production.
* Great eye and experience working with prints and graphics in Adobe AI and PS: researching, creating direction, recoloring, editing, sizing, placing on garments, pitching
* Communicate development process with cross functioning teams, vendors, factories and freelance designers
* Create and maintain various forms of seasonal WIP reports that serve as powerful tools for internal and external insight

**Requirements:**

* Proficient in systems such as Outlook, Word, Excel, PLM
* Strong communication and writing skills
* Strong attention to detail and ability to prioritize
* Self-motivated and self-directed with continuous desire to learn and grow
* Flexible and agile learner able to adapt to the changing needs of the business
* Exceptional time management and organizational skills with ability to multi task in a fast-paced environment
* Proactive problem solver able to trouble shoot and/or escalate issues effectively
* Knowledge in Adobe Illustrator is a plus
* Interest in Fitness and Sports is a **huge plus**

Capelli Sport LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, ancestry, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, religion, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.

title: Product Designer, Design Systems
description:
**About Rippling**
------------------

Rippling gives businesses one place to run HR, IT, and Finance. It brings together all of the workforce systems that are normally scattered across a company, like payroll, expenses, benefits, and computers. For the first time ever, you can manage and automate every part of the employee lifecycle in a single system.

Take onboarding, for example. With Rippling, you can hire a new employee anywhere in the world and set up their payroll, corporate card, computer, benefits, and even third-party apps like Slack and Microsoft 365—all within 90 seconds.

Based in San Francisco, CA, Rippling has raised $1.4B+ from the world’s top investors—including Kleiner Perkins, Founders Fund, Sequoia, Greenoaks, and Bedrock—and was named one of America's best startup employers by Forbes.

We prioritize candidate safety. Please be aware that all official communication will only be sent from @Rippling.com addresses.

**About the role**
------------------

The Rippling Design System team is responsible for ensuring every product at Rippling has an exceptional and unified user experience. Design Systems does this by developing the key building blocks used by our entire product suite and developing a system that our design, engineering, and product teams can leverage quickly and effectively. Because Design Systems is at the heart of the Rippling Platform, this is one of the highest-impact positions at Rippling. Our platform approach is a key differentiator in a world of otherwise-fragmented business applications. Read more about the Rippling Platform at https://www.rippling.com/platform.

As a Designer on the Design Systems team, you'll execute on high-impact projects on the Design Systems team. You'll work with many teams across Rippling to drive key, platform-wide projects and design components that will be adopted into the Rippling platform that will become exceptional experiences for Rippling’s end users. You will be working very closely with the Frontend-Platform team to help build and manage our global design language and library of components. Your work will enable all the teams at Rippling to move quickly and at great scale, while maintaining our high-quality bar.

**What you will do**
--------------------

* Become an authority on Rippling’s design language, setting standards for our design system and how systems thinking is embedded within Rippling’s design practice.
* Lead the design of high-impact patterns, component redesigns, and cross-cutting features of our design system.
* Level up the design team by helping mentor other designers, defining processes as we scale, participating in designer interviews, and leading by example in how you operate on a team.
* Collaborate with different partners to design components in accordance with your team's roadmap.
* Effectively manage your time and process to meet team deadlines.
* Create and validate designs through sketches, prototypes, and testing.
* Work with Engineering to ensure quality implementation and user experience.
* Create high-fidelity visuals and specifications for your final design solutions.
* Provide regular design feedback to other designers and engineers on implementing and contributing to our design system, and solicit feedback from them to ensure we’re addressing product needs.

**What you will need**
----------------------

* 3+ years of experience as a design system or product designer, contributing to or leading the design and visual execution of product experiences.
* Experience with design systems experience is highly preferred.
* B.A/B.S. in Graphic Design, Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, or equivalent experience (a degree is not required)
* An outstanding portfolio showcasing a depth of knowledge in user experience, interaction, and visual/user interface design.
* Experience shipping and documenting high-quality component libraries.
* Experience partnering with Product Managers, Engineers, and Product Designers to execute on component deliverables.
* Experience with prototyping as a means to explore and convey design solutions.

Even if you don’t meet all of the requirements listed here, we still encourage you to apply. Skills can be used in lots of different ways and your life and professional experience may be relevant beyond what a list of requirements will capture.

**Additional Information**
--------------------------

Rippling is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce and do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other legally protected characteristics, Rippling is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for candidates with disabilities who need assistance during the hiring process. To request a reasonable accommodation, please email accomodations@rippling.com

Rippling highly values having employees working in-office to foster a collaborative work environment and company culture. For office-based employees (employees who live within a defined radius of a Rippling office), Rippling considers working in the office, at least three days a week under current policy, to be an essential function of the employee's role.

This role will receive a competitive salary + benefits + equity. The salary for US-based employees will be aligned with one of the ranges below based on location; see which tier applies to your location here.

A variety of factors are considered when determining someone’s compensation–including a candidate’s professional background, experience, and location. Final offer amounts may vary from the amounts listed below.

 **The pay range for this role is:**  
117,000 - 204,750 USD per year(US Tier 1)

title: Social Media Marketing Manager
description:
**Job Summary**  
We are seeking a creative and strategic Social Media / Marketing Manager to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for developing and overseeing emails and social media strategies that enhance our brand presence, engage our audience, and drive traffic to our platforms. This role requires a blend of creativity, analytical skills, and a passion for storytelling through digital media.

**Responsibilities**

* Develop and implement social media strategies to increase brand awareness and engagement across various platforms.
* Create Monthly Marketing Calendar
* Manage published content (images, video, written) that aligns with the brand’s voice and objectives.. Manage editors content creation
* Utilize tools for scheduling and monitoring social media posts.
* Conduct research on industry trends and competitor activities to inform content creation and strategy adjustments.
* Optimize content for search engines (SEO) to enhance visibility and reach.
* Collaborate with graphic designers to produce visually appealing graphics
* Manage relationships with influencers and partners to expand reach and engagement.
* Monitor social media channels for customer feedback, inquiries, and comments; respond promptly to foster community engagement.
* Proofread all content before publication to ensure accuracy and adherence to brand guidelines.

**Qualifications**

Must have prior social media or marketing experience.

* Proven experience as a Social Media Manager or similar role in digital marketing.
* Ability to manage the content calendar, emails, promotions
* Strong knowledge of social media platforms including Instagram, Facebook
* Proficiency in using social media management tools
* Familiarity with SEO best practices to enhance online visibility.
* Basic photography skills are a plus for creating original content.
* Excellent relationship management skills with the ability to engage effectively with diverse audiences.
* Strong research skills to stay updated on industry trends and best practices.
* Exceptional proofreading abilities with keen attention to detail.

Join us in shaping our online presence while driving meaningful engagement within our community!

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $24.00 per hour

Expected hours: 10 per week

Benefits:

* Employee discount
* Flexible schedule

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Work Location: In person

title: Marketing and Sales Associate
description:
**Position Overview:**

Join our dynamic team as a Marketing and Sales Associate, where you will drive our marketing efforts and support sales initiatives for Costikyan and PG brands. This role combines creative content creation, customer engagement, and strategic support across multiple platforms to enhance our market presence and sales effectiveness. We offer a hybrid work schedule, allowing for a balance of remote work and in-office collaboration.

**About Us:**

Founded in 1886, Costikyan is a luxury service provider specializing in high-end textiles, including rugs, carpeting, upholstery, and draperies. Our services encompass cleaning, restoration, protection, installation, fabrication, and deliveries. We cater to a diverse clientele, including homeowners, interior designers, architects, and designer showrooms. We operate throughout the New York Tri-State area and nationwide, delivering unmatched quality and service in every aspect of our work.

**Office Locations:**

* **East Rutherford, NJ:** 163 E Union Ave, East Rutherford, NJ 07073
* **Long Island City, NY:** 37-11 48th Avenue, Long Island City, NY 11101

**Work Schedule:**

* This position will begin with in-person training and onboarding. After approximately 2 to 3 months, upon successful completion of training, the role transitions to a fully remote schedule.

**Responsibilities:**

**Content Marketing (60%)**

* **Email Campaigns:** Design and execute monthly email campaigns for both Costikyan and PG brands, including managing and cleaning email lists, sourcing compelling imagery, copywriting, and scheduling emails using platforms like MailChimp.
* **Strategic Collaboration:** Work closely with the Marketing Director to devise strategies for growing our social media and email audience.
* **Content Support:** Provide copywriting and content creation for various marketing materials including emails, websites, flyers, and more.
* **Photo and Video Coordination:** Organize and manage monthly photoshoots with our videographer to ensure fresh, appealing content. Utilize basic graphic design tools like Canva for creating visual content.

**Sales Support (25%)**

* **Customer Support and Optimization:** Stay up to date on order notifications and details for the PG brand, ensuring timely communication with the sales team and customers as needed. Identify opportunities for order growth, facilitate the closing of pending sales, and manage customer feedback effectively.
* **Promotion and Materials:** Support outreach efforts to promote company news and events, and provide necessary marketing materials for sales events.
* **Training:** Train new sales hires on the effective use of various marketing and sales platforms to boost productivity.

**Marketing Support & Administrative (15%)**

* **Strategic Support:** Assist the Marketing Director in implementing growth strategies, maintaining online listing consistency, and organizing events.
* **Operational Consistency:** Ensure accurate and up-to-date company details across all listings, including business hours and other critical information.
* **Resource Provisioning:** Provide essential tools, such as email signatures and business cards, to new hires.
* **Inventory Management:** Oversee inventory of marketing materials, including promotional items and marketing toolkits.
* **Vendor Coordination:** Supply content and information to vendors as needed to support marketing initiatives.

**Online Presence:**

* **Website:** Costikyan.com
* **Instagram:** Costikyannyc

**Candidate Profile:**

* **Must have a bachelor’s degree in Communications, Marketing, or a related field.**
* **Proven experience in content marketing and sales support.**
* **Proficient in copywriting, email marketing, social media marketing, customer service, and marketing administration.**
* **Familiarity with social media platforms like Instagram, Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, TikTok, and LinkedIn.**
* **Experience with email marketing tools such as MailChimp, and CRMs like Salesforce or NetSuite.**
* **Basic graphic design skills and familiarity with tools like Canva.**
* **Strong organizational and communication skills, with the ability to multitask effectively in a fast-paced environment.**
* **Creative thinker with a keen eye for detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving.**
* **Versatile team player capable of working independently, within a team, across teams, and with outside vendors and partners.**

**Application Process:**

* **Interested candidates should send their resume to Laura at laura@rugrenovating.com.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $45,000.00 - $50,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Work from home

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Hybrid remote in East Rutherford, NJ 07073

title: Junior Architectural Designer - New Construction, Multi-family, Mixed-Use
company: Beyer Blinder Belle Architects and Planners LLP
description:
Beyer Blinder Belle Architects and Planners LLP is an award-winning architecture and urban design firm committed to design excellence. Founded in 1968, we have offices in New York City, Washington DC, D.C., Miami and Boston. Our New York office is currently seeking talented, creative and motivated designers to work on complex projects, including residential, commercial, mixed-use developments, and master plans.  
Candidates for the Junior Architectural Designer position must exhibit a strong design sense, sound technical skills, and an ability to contribute to a creative process to develop innovative design concepts and solutions. Ideal candidates will demonstrate the following attributes:

* 1-2 years of professional experience in architecture (full-time)
* Strong graphics, design, organization, and communication skills.
* High proficiency in the use of AutoCAD, and fluency in Revit is a plus.
* Excellent skills in 3D Modeling (Rhino) and Rendering (Enscape, V-ray).
* Outstanding graphic design skills (Adobe Creative Suite).
* Ability to communicate design ideas and direction clearly and effectively.
* Collaborative and professional work ethic.
* Basic knowledge of materials, construction methods, and building codes.
* Excellent problem solver with good listening skills and strong follow-through.
* Experience with multi-family, commercial, or mixed-use building design preferred.

**Compensation**

BBB offers fair and equitable pay. A reasonable estimate of the base salary range for this role is $58,000 - $66,000, with variations depending on experience, education, achievements, and business needs. Employees may also receive an annual performance-based bonus and salary increase.

**Benefits**

BBB is committed to supporting your well-being, professional development, and work-life balance. Benefits include:

* Health: Medical, dental, and vision coverage (with a no-premium option)
* Financial: 401(k) plan (pre-tax/ and or Roth), pre-tax healthcare and dependent care savings plans, commuter transit/parking programs, and life/disability insurance.
* Paid Time: PTO, holidays, and paid volunteer opportunities.
* Professional Development: Subsidies for ARE exam fees, AIA membership dues, and other professional expenses.
* Wellness: Fitness Discounts, mental health support, and wellness programs.
* Culture: Mentorship programs and employee resource groups.

As an equal-opportunity employer, BBB is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workforce where everyone is valued and respected.

In line with our commitment to providing equal opportunities to all candidates, we want to ensure that the interview process is accessible to everyone. If you require any accommodations to facilitate your participation in the interview, please email HR@bbbarch.com to discuss any accommodations or support you may require. Your request will be handled with the utmost confidentiality and respect. We appreciate your interest in pursuing a career with Beyer Blinder Belle.
